data.title: Corn, Beans, and Squash
data.statement:
In this rectangular [[garden]], there are corn ({{c}}), beans ({{b}}), and squash ({{s}})
The corn will only grow well if it's next to at least one {{b}} and at least one {{s}}

"next to" means above, below, or to the side; it does <<not>> mean diagonal


<<Your Task>>
Reprint the garden, with this change:
If the corn will grow well, replace {{c}} with {{C}}
If not, replace {{c}} with {{_}}

Additionally, determine:
How many of the corn will grow well ([[goodCorn]])
How many of the corn won't grow well ([[badCorn]])
What percentage of the corn (rounded to the nearest whole number) will grow well ([[percentageOfGoodCorn]])




~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Inspiration for this clash (which is quite interesting, but NOT needed to solve this clash):
The Iroquois believe corn, beans and squash are precious gifts from the Great Spirit, each watched over by one of three sisters spirits, called the De-o-ha-ko, or Our Sustainers.
Source:
https://www.reneesgarden.com/blogs/gardening-resources/celebrate-the-three-sisters-corn-beans-and-squash

data.stubGenerator:
read height:int
loop height read gardenRow:string(1024)
write successs, failures, percentage, and garden itself
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer, [[height]] of the rectangular [[garden]]
<<Next [[height]] Lines:>> Strings, rows of the [[garden]], consisting only of {{c}}, {{b}}, and {{s}}
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An Integer, [[goodCorn]]
<<Line 2:>> An Integer, [[badCorn]]
<<Line 3:>> An Integer, [[percentageOfGoodCorn]]{{%}}
<<Next [[height]] Lines: >> [[garden]] with each {{c}} changed to either {{C}} or {{_}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In this rectangular garden, there are corn (c), beans (b), and squash (s)
The corn will only grow well if it's next to at least one b and at least one s

"next to" means above, below, or to the side; it does not mean diagonal


Your Task
Reprint the garden, with this change:
If the corn will grow well, replace c with C
If not, replace c with _

Additionally, determine:
How many of the corn will grow well (goodCorn)
How many of the corn won't grow well (badCorn)
What percentage of the corn (rounded to the nearest whole number) will grow well (percentageOfGoodCorn)




~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
Inspiration for this clash (which is quite interesting, but NOT needed to solve this clash):
The Iroquois believe corn, beans and squash are precious gifts from the Great Spirit, each watched over by one of three sisters spirits, called the De-o-ha-ko, or Our Sustainers.
Source:
https://www.reneesgarden.com/blogs/gardening-resources/celebrate-the-three-sisters-corn-beans-and-squash
Input
Line 1: An integer, height of the rectangular garden
Next height Lines: Strings, rows of the garden, consisting only of c, b, and s
Output
Line 1: An Integer, goodCorn
Line 2: An Integer, badCorn
Line 3: An Integer, percentageOfGoodCorn%
Next height Lines: garden with each c changed to either C or _
Constraints
height and width of garden are < 40
Example
Input
2
cbcb
bcsc
Output
3
1
75%
_bCb
bCsC
